Articles.Content:
[quote name='Caelib']I support the decision, you should spend the holidays relaxing with family and friends, rather than recovering from an aggressive deadline![/QUOTE]

But but... Jeb, Bill, Bob and 'Tina *are* my family and friends....!

[quote name='Caelib']I support the decision, you should spend the holidays relaxing with family and friends, rather than recovering from an aggressive deadline![/QUOTE]

Oh yeah, about that...

[quote name='Warzouz']Why not instead of random contract, allow the player to create it's own contract with it's own objectives (parts from existing contract system). KSP would after that set a reward based on the chosen objectives, and the reputation and maybe the already don contracts. (Landing at tylo a second time would be less rewarding than the first).

I know the contract interface would need a total rework, but that could be more RP and more like existing space exploration works.[/QUOTE]

It would be nice to have this mechanic but only for the high tier facility.

[quote][color=#333333]a good relay system will for example allow you to return more science from instruments than is currently possible but it will require a lot more work to set up. Think of how the curiosity rover uses the mars reconnaissance orbiter to send signals home, or how philae uses rosetta to do the same.[/color][/quote]
^this!!!
These devnote slooks great, I can wait until 2016, I just got Kerbin 365 and a lot of mods,cthat ahould keep me going for a bit.

[quote name='amorymeltzer']Looking forward to the KSPlay on broadway![/QUOTE]

*like*

Sweet Jesus.... A game company that doesn't rush its product. I'm quite certain that there is ice in hell today! Take your time guys. Stability for a release tomorrow > possible problems on a release today.

Dr_Turkey, I like how you're much more interactive with the forum than other dev members, just saying :)

Also, have you guys fixed the scene change memory leak? That's one of the last major memory leaks still around.

[quote name='smjjames']Dr_Turkey, I like how you're much more interactive with the forum than other dev members, just saying :)[/QUOTE]
The actual Devs have stuff to do (you know, the Development). Unlike the producer, who doesn't ever do anything as is well known. :P

[quote name='Kobymaru']The actual Devs have stuff to do (you know, the Development). Unlike the producer, who doesn't ever do anything as is well known. :P[/QUOTE]

Maxmaps wasn't as interactive with the community either AFAIK.

[quote name='smjjames']Maxmaps wasn't as interactive with the community either AFAIK.[/QUOTE]
That depends on how you define community.

[quote name='Kobymaru']The actual Devs have stuff to do (you know, the Development). Unlike the producer, who doesn't ever do anything as is well known. :P[/QUOTE]


Well, today I must survive. Does that count?

[COLOR="silver"][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[quote name='smjjames']Dr_Turkey, I like how you're much more interactive with the forum than other dev members, just saying :) [/QUOTE]

Well, this couple of minutes a day thinking of silly stuff to write are actually quite appreciated by me and my mental health. Not so much by my schedule.
I see no problem delaying 1.1. Better to have fewer bugs than a rushed release.
Thanks for pushing the release date to 2016, I appreciate that you rather release quality. :)
By 2016 u mean and of January or when? Don't rush but I kinda wanna play with the relay network and wheels.
2016 sounds like its goint to be a great year! Roll on 1.1 at your pace and yours alone. Its going to be excellent :)

WHY! (Still take your time)

Why can't I enjoy 1.0.5 with 64bit hack on my Mac?!
Oh dear, it seems the forum conversion has taken it's toll on this post..
We are going to need dates on the daily kerbal now

1 hour ago, JPmAn said:

We are going to need dates on the daily kerbal now

why?

It already has 'By SQUAD, 24 November' under the title.

As that is the date of the original post, it seems like it should be adequate to distinguish similarly titled devnotes...

I do feel that the Devnote subforum does suffer from being sorted by latest-reply-first. It definitely needs to be locked into latest-OP-first, or else someone could dig up an old devnote, for instance, and make it appear that it was posted early. Or hide the new devnote behind an old one, so people never notice it.
(I know this is probably the wrong place for this complaint; I'm going to bring this up where it can be seen by people who can do something about it.)
Yeah I thought this was the Devnote for this week at a glance, but then I noticed the date and the amount of replies...
I'm fully supportive of the delay. More time for me to play around with my current mods, and more time before the possibility of BDArmory 8.8.3 no longer working
Locked, to ease the growing pains of the new forum. Please check the post dates of the Dev Notes to find the most recent.
